body:
Similar problem here while using mypy==1.3.0.

My example code:
```python
data = """
{foo}
bar >
baz
"""

prompt = None
reponse = None
lines = data.splitlines()
for line in lines:
    if prompt and reponse:  # mypy error: Right operand of "and" is never evaluated  [unreachable]
        print("Break reached!")  # mypy error: Statement is unreachable  [unreachable]
        break
    if not prompt and line.endswith(">"):
        prompt = line
        continue
    if not reponse and line.endswith("}"):
        reponse = line
        continue
```
Run output:
```
$ python example.py
Break reached!
$

Here looking at this issue after my PR fails on CI.
![image](https://github.com/python/mypy/assets/1215497/7ef4da5d-dc8b-48c4-aefd-ef41072258c7)

issue.title: core: services: cable_guy: Move interface priority from ipr to dhcpcd

repository.name: BlueOS
repository.description: The open source platform for ROV, USV, robotic system operation, development, and expansion.

issue.body:
Fix #1539

Right now to have it working it's required to do a system reboot.
Doing dhcpcd service restart breaks our wpa_supplicant connection. #1958 was an attempt to fix that.

issue.title: warn_unreachable false positive when reassigning in loop
issue.body:
**Bug Report**

**To Reproduce**

-Run this code with `warn_unreachable` enabled:

```python
x: int|None = None
x = None
for _ in range(2):
    if x is None:
        print('None')
        x = 2
    else:
        print('Not None')
```
([Mypy playground](https://mypy-play.net/?mypy=latest&python=3.11&flags=warn-unreachable&gist=eebb82e6de21417cbc24c43e75dca970))

**Expected Behavior**

No errors.

**Actual Behavior**

```
main.py:8: error: Statement is unreachable  [unreachable]
```

(this is wrong, the script indeed hits line 8 and prints `Not None`)

**Your Environment**

<!-- Include as many relevant details about the environment you experienced the bug in -->

- Mypy version used: 1.5.1
- Mypy configuration options from `mypy.ini` (and other config files):  `warn_unreachable = true`
- Python version used: 3.11.4

body:
+1 

Here is a smaller example:
```python
state = None
for x in 'ab':
    if state is not None:
        print('reachable')
    state = 'x'
```
The script output:
```
reachable
```
Mypy error:
```python
main.py:4:9: error: Statement is unreachable  [unreachable]
            print('reachable')
            ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Found 1 error in 1 file (checked 1 source file)

âœ• mypy failed.
```
@grihabor and @Melebius your issues were fixed by https://github.com/python/mypy/pull/18433, though the initial example was not.

issue.title: Add warn-unreachable to strict mode
issue.body:
This is useful check for dead code analysis. Iff the rate of false-positives is low enough, then this is a worthwhile addition to strict. I am currently slowly investigating the current rate of false-positives (eg looking at the hits in ðŸ”²https://github.com/python/mypy/issues/10806 ; ðŸ”²https://github.com/python/mypy/issues/14987 ; âœ…"mypyc/ir/pprint.py:231: error: Statement is unreachable") and seeing if it's low enough and/or can be made lower

This PR is largely a copy of https://github.com/python/mypy/pull/17944 , which is now closed.

Fixes #7469, #11223, #18078.

This adds a useful check to the default list of strict arguments.

I personally do not see this as a breaking change, due to the documentation of --strict stating it may include different flags over time. I think this could just be in a minor version. (Either way, this pull request could be used.)

body:
I tend to think the problem underlying the initial example has nothing to do with loops but with promotions, because both `float` and `int` are involved.

So, maybe this is a simpler repro:

```python
x: float | None
y: int | None
z: int
reveal_type(x)  # float | None
x = y
reveal_type(x)  # None   !!!!!!!!!
x = z
reveal_type(x)  # int
```

With "normal" subtypes, the same type of type narrowing works:

```python
class A: ...
class B(A): ...

a: A | None
b: B | None
c: B
reveal_type(a)  # A | None
a = b
reveal_type(a)  # B | None
a = c
reveal_type(a)  # B
``` 

Likely, an attempt to solve this could start here:

https://github.com/python/mypy/blob/5a0fa556be741270e25c95a923ef8450d28dd448/mypy/meet.py#L130C1-L145C10

issue.title: Improve the support for promotions inside unions.
issue.body:
Fixes #14987

I was puzzled as to why my previous attempts to avoid false `unreachable` warnings for loops failed for issue #14987.  After some debugging, I realised that the underlying problem is that type narrowing does not work with promotions if both the declared type and the constraining type are unions:

```python
x: float | None
y: int | None
x = y
reveal_type(x)  #  None !!!
```

The fix seems straightforward (but let's see what the Mypy primer says) and is checked by the test cases  `testNarrowPromotionsInsideUnions1` and `testNarrowPromotionsInsideUnions2`.
